summary: This is an FBI 302 interview report of a Bureau of Prisons Lieutenant conducted on August 12, 2019, regarding the circumstances surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death by suicide at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 10, 2019. The lieutenant details his interactions with Epstein, prison protocols, staffing issues, and the events immediately before and after Epstein's death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The high-profile inmate who died by suicide in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on August 10, 2019. The interview details his housing, interactions with staff, and the events leading to his death.

persons.name: Lieutenant
persons.context: The interviewee, a BOP lieutenant at MCC who supervised the Special Housing Unit (SHU). He describes his duties, interactions with Epstein, and the prison's protocols and staffing around the time of Epstein's death.

persons.name: FBI Special Agent
persons.context: One of the interviewing agents from the FBI's Office of the Inspector General (OIG) who conducted the interview with the BOP lieutenant.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: An AUSA from the Southern District of New York present during the FBI interview of the BOP lieutenant.

persons.name: Lieutenant

connections.description: The lieutenant supervised Epstein in the SHU and assisted him with setting up a phone call to his mother on August 9, 2019, the night before his death.
The lieutenant reports to the Captain, who always works the day watch.

events.title: Epstein's Previous Suicide Attempt
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein attempted to commit suicide while housed in the SHU. Following this, a doctor instructed SHU personnel that Epstein must always have a cellmate, though this order was communicated verbally, not in writing.

events.title: Epstein's Phone Call to His Mother
events.description: The BOP lieutenant assisted Jeffrey Epstein in making a 15-minute phone call from the SHU shower area. Epstein called a male at a number beginning with 954, was described as very happy, and made a comment like 'Hey, how you doing? How's everything?'

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found deceased in his cell at MCC, slumped over with a noose around his neck. His body was later transported by the Office of Chief Medical Examiner (OCME) using a diversion tactic to avoid media.

events.title: 10:00 PM Stand-up Count
events.description: During the 10:00 p.m. stand-up count on the night of August 9/10, a CO reported that Epstein gave him a thumbs-up, indicating he was alive and responsive at that time.

events.title: FBI/OIG Interview of BOP Lieutenant
events.description: FBI Special Agents and an AUSA interviewed a BOP lieutenant regarding the circumstances of Jeffrey Epstein's death and prison protocols at MCC.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), 150 Park Row, New York, New York
FBI-New York offices, 290 Broadway, New York, New York
MCC hospital on Park Row, New York, New York
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found deceased in his cell on August 10, 2019, with a noose around his neck.

Following a previous suicide attempt in July 2019, Epstein was supposed to always have a cellmate, but this order was communicated verbally, not in writing, and his cellmate had not returned from court on the Friday before his death.
The MCC's video surveillance system was not functioning properly at the time of Epstein's death, though staff operated under the assumption it was working.
The BOP lieutenant interviewed assisted Epstein with a phone call to a male (potentially his mother) on the evening of August 9, 2019, and described Epstein as being in a good mood.
After Epstein's death, prison staff used a diversion tactic with a decoy body to transport Epstein's remains past the media unnoticed.
